div.p: From Eliza Bromby to James McCulloch
M65/11597, unit 209, VPRS 3991/P inwards registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Office, Public Record Office, Victoria.

Transcribed 20.8.93. To proof.
Enclosed with the above letter is a contingencies form made out to Mrs Jane Cutts, Honorary Treasurer of the Ladies' Leichardt Search Committee, 13 December 1865, for the Government's grant in aid of the Ladies Leichhardt Search Expedition of £500.
Annotation letter to Mrs Bromby 27th Decr/65, D432. Get from outwards.
I have been requested to ask if you would oblige the Leichhardt Search Committee by intimating to the Chief Secretary the hope entertained, that the grant voted by the Legislative Assembly in aid of their enterprise may be paid to their account at the London Chartered Bank as soon as possible. As the year is drawing to a close, the Committee would avoid the difficulty that might arise in obtaining the sum, were the payment longer delayed. I trust you will excuse me for giving you this trouble
